intro: Carpacoce spermacocea, commonly known as the golden broom, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow inflorescences, which consist of dense clusters of small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in sunny, well-drained soils and is native to regions of southern Africa. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. Carpacoce spermacocea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its vibrant color and attractive floral display.
